name: UITabBarDelegate
desc: The UITabBarDelegate protocol defines optional methods for a delegate of a UITabBar object. The UITabBar class provides the ability for the user to reorder, remove, and add items to the tab bar; this process is referred to as customizing the tab bar. The tab bar delegate receives messages when customizing occurs.

items.name: func tabBar(UITabBar, willBeginCustomizing: [UITabBarItem])
items.desc: Sent to the delegate before the customizing modal view is displayed.

items.name: func tabBar(UITabBar, didBeginCustomizing: [UITabBarItem])
items.desc: Sent to the delegate after the customizing modal view is displayed.

items.name: func tabBar(UITabBar, willEndCustomizing: [UITabBarItem], changed: Bool)
items.desc: Sent to the delegate before the customizing modal view is dismissed.

items.name: func tabBar(UITabBar, didEndCustomizing: [UITabBarItem], changed: Bool)
items.desc: Sent to the delegate after the customizing modal view is dismissed.

items.name: func tabBar(UITabBar, didSelect: UITabBarItem)
items.desc: Sent to the delegate when the user selects a tab bar item.
